On 8/7/13 3:12 PM, Niels wrote:
> Hello, Is there any documentation about what happens to the queue
> when a toe thread is killed? I have been waiting for 21 threads to
> finish for 2 days now and am thinking of just killing them off. Is
> the queue at all affected if threads are killed half-way through?
> Mainly, I care if the thread hold large amounts of information about
> the current crawl state and thus would heavily affect the crawl
> integrity. Niels

Killing a thread via the ToeThread.kill() method tries to be safe, 
aborting the URI in progress as a failure and telling the ToeThread not 
to proceed any further.

But, depending on the exact cause/position of the stall, and whether the 
ToeThread is doing anything else (especially anything involving custom 
components/state), it might not be completely clean.

Can you say more about the relevant ToeThreads' current state?

What Heritrix version, and what does a thread stack dump show?

Standard config and behavior should make network fetches time-out much 
earlier, so there's something unique (perhaps an undiagnosed/unnoticed 
error?) if you have threads that seem to stuck doing the exact same 
thing for many hours.

- Gordon
